datafield.subfield: 750 GeV Diphoton Excess from Cascade Decay
750 GeV Diphoton Excess from Cascade Decay

Motivated by the recent 750 GeV diphoton excess observed by the ATLAS and CMS collaborations, we propose a simplified model to explain this excess. Model-independent constraints and predictions on the allowed couplings for generating the observed diphoton excess are studied in detail, and the compatibility between Run 1 and Run 2 data is considered simultaneously. We demonstrate that the possible four photon signal can be used to test this scenario, and also explain the interesting deviation for a diphoton mass of about 1.6 TeV by ATLAS, where the local significance is 2.8 $\sigma$. Meanwhile, this scenario also provides us with the dark matter candidates.

00007 The predicted $gg\rightarrow 4\gamma$ cross section in the allowed parameter space with $c_{rgg}=0.4$. The cross section for $gg\rightarrow r\rightarrow \alpha\alpha\rightarrow 2\gamma 2a$ is required to larger than 10 fb. Other constraints from the width of $\alpha$ and $r$, and dijet resonances searching are also included.

00005 The predicted $gg\rightarrow 4\gamma$ cross section in $N_{\alpha}-N_{r}$ plane with $c_{rgg}=0.2$. The cross section for $gg\rightarrow r\rightarrow \alpha\alpha\rightarrow 2\gamma 2a$ is required to larger than 10 fb. Other constraints from the width of $\alpha$ and $r$, and dijet resonances searching are also included.
00000 The Feynman diagram for the production of the 750 GeV diphoton excess.

00008 The predicted $gg\rightarrow r \rightarrow 2\gamma$ cross section. The constraints mainly comes from that we require the cross section $gg\rightarrow r\rightarrow \alpha\alpha\rightarrow 2\gamma 2a$ is between $10\pm 3$ fb. Other constraints on the couplings discussed above are also included.

00001 Left: The constraint of $c_{rgg}$ and $N_r$ from the width of $r$, where we assume that the $r$ width is less than 100 GeV. Right: The constraint of $c_{\alpha\gamma\gamma}$ and $N_{\alpha}$ from the width of $\alpha$, where we assume that the $\alpha$ width is between $30 \sim 50$~GeV. Here, the colored region corresponds to allowed parameter spaces.

00006 The predicted $gg\rightarrow 4\gamma$ cross section in the allowed parameter space with $c_{rgg}=0.3$. The cross section for $gg\rightarrow r\rightarrow \alpha\alpha\rightarrow 2\gamma 2a$ is required to larger than 10 fb. Other constraints from the width of $\alpha$ and $r$, and dijet resonances searching are also included.

00002 Left: The constraint of $c_{rgg}$ and $N_r$ from the width of $r$, where we assume that the $r$ width is less than 100 GeV. Right: The constraint of $c_{\alpha\gamma\gamma}$ and $N_{\alpha}$ from the width of $\alpha$, where we assume that the $\alpha$ width is between $30 \sim 50$~GeV. Here, the colored region corresponds to allowed parameter spaces.

00003 The constraint for $N_{\alpha}$ and $N_{r}$ when fixing $c_{rgg}$. In order to generate excess with over 10 fb cross sectioin, $c_{rgg}$ need to be larger than 0.2-0.4 for different benchmark point. The red, green and blue band stand for the cross section of diphoton excess which is larger than 10 fb when setting $c_{rgg}=0.2,0.3,0.4$, respectively.

00004 The contour plot for $c_{rgg}$ and $N_{r}$, when fixing $N_{\alpha}=1,10,5$, respectively, and assuming diphoton excess larger than 10 fb. The colored region denote that 10 fb diphoton excess can not be produced.
